title: NBN

embed.description: Joint release with Senator The Hon Mathias Cormann Minister for Finance The Commonwealth Government, NBN Co and Telstra have today signed landmark agreements that will allow the National Broadband Network (NBN) to be completed sooner and at less expense to taxpayers.

body: What does everyone think about this ?

replies.body:
Meh just means Telstra gets to treat their customers like %%%% even more.
There isn't any real competition in telecommunications in this country, so Telstra who practically owns the internet in Australia get to be as rigid and terrible on their internet plans as they want.

We need something like Google Fiber to come along and provide competition, our internet is far too behind the rest of the world.

> [{quoted}](name=Klavinmour,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=cwLaqPQq,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2014-12-14T15:52:50.803+0000)
> Meh just means Telstra gets to treat their customers like %%%% even more.
> There isn't any real competition in telecommunications in this country, so Telstra who practically owns the internet in Australia get to be as rigid and terrible on their internet plans as they want.
> 
> We need something like Google Fiber to come along and provide competition, our internet is far too behind the rest of the world.

Telstra alrady owns everything Optus have to pay Telstra rent to use there lines and so does everyone else (Optus still has the best plans though $100 unlimited adsl 2+ and landline and mobile calls within Aus)
Damn, where I live in the country Optus is super expensive. The only option is literally testra.

So in other words they are changing the roll out to be fiber to the node, and not fiber to the door.... it will reduce the speeds to 1/4 of fiber to the door at the very minimum. As long as this just the first stage, and afterwards they do a second stage and change it to fiber to the door then that's ok, but if they are just screwing us and giving us something significantly less then its pretty crap.

There would be very little difference from ADSL 2+ with the different roll out.

Pretty sure the money the gov has spent already on this plus the money they are spending to sell it to Telstra is already more than what Labors was gonna be. 
Not to mention that its gonna take longer now.
Not to mention that the HCF Line they plan to use is old Copper cabling which is literlaly worse than a majority of 3rd world countries. 

Believe me, i live on a net thats worse than 94% of all of Aus, last game i had to give up a free win cause my sister was on the net doing stuff for her car and i was constantly 2.5k ping.

I have a Max Download of 150kbs and according to the Libs, we are meant to get 11mb/s. I got

lol dream on mate, we will be old men before any of that ends up happening, and even still, it will be slower than what is already available elsewhere int he world.


{{summoner:3}}

> [{quoted}](name=Geldour,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=cwLaqPQq,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2014-12-14T17:57:25.859+0000)
> lol dream on mate, we will be old men before any of that ends up happening, and even still, it will be slower than what is already available elsewhere int he world.
> 
> 
> {{summoner:3}}

I get it within the next year :D but that's because I don't live close to the city
